data: A night lamp—the chosen companion of illness, misery and murder—burned dimly on a little table in the midst of a grim array of bottles and boxes.
A night lamp--the chosen companion of illness, misery and murder--burned dimly on a little table in the midst of a grim array of bottles and boxes.
Madame X: a story of mother-love
McConaughy, J. W.; Bisson, Alexandre, 1848-1912; Volkert, Edward Charles, 1871-1935 [Illustrator]
